docs.text: Managing a repository can be cumbersome and tiresome . Let alone managing multiple repositories used by multiple contributors and bots . My name is auto-me-bot ! I was created with Probot and I live my life as a serverless function residing in AWS Lambda . I'm here to take some of the load off your shoulders, just tell me what you want me to do... Place a file called auto-me-bot.yml in your .github folder in the repos you want me to help out with. Installation ⚓︎ Install me from GitHub marketplace and select the repos you want me to keep an eye out for. Events I work with pull_request Permissions I require scope permission checks write metadata read pull_requests read metadata:read is mandatory. Configuration ⚓︎ I take my instructions in yaml . If I can't find my configuration file in the repo I'm working with, I'll look for it in your .github repo. .github/auto-me-bot.yml --- pr : conventionalCommits : # (1) signedCommits : # (2) tasksList : # (3) this means I'll enforce conventional commit messages in PRs. this means I'll make sure all commits in PRs are signed with the 'Signed-off-by' trailer. this means I'll verify the completion of the tasks list in PRs. Look-See ⚓︎ all handlers successful all handlers failed conventional commits successful conventional commits failed signed commits successful signed commits failed tasks list successful tasks lists failed tasks lists non-found Spec ⚓︎ I was built with Probot . I was documented with Material for MkDocs . My art, i.e. my logo, was created with DiceBear . I'm deployed to AWS Lambda . My docs are deployed to GitHub Pages . My source code, of course, is stored on GitHub .
